content: chain from the hook and the next 3 st s single_crochet x 4 in the last st continue around working into the remaining loops of the opposite side of the foundation chain single_crochet in the next 3 st s single_crochet x 3 in the last st photo 2 don t turn and don t join just keep working around making the first st of the next round in the first st of this round 14 place a piece of scrap yarn over your work to act as a running stitch marker see the front page for more details and photo 3 for an illus- tration use scrap yarn as running stitch marker 1 2 3 2 *single_crochet x 5 single_crochet increase x 2* x 2 see photo 4 18 3 in blo single_crochet x 18 see photo 5 18 4-6 single_crochet x 18 see photo 6 18 ridge formed by working into the blo in round 3 4 5 6 2 you will now work the window so leave the end of round 6 alone for a minute and work the window as follows a with white yarn and a slip knot already on your hook join the white yarn by making a fpsc around the post of the next st to do this insert your hook from front to back into the first st of round 6 then insert it from back to front into the second st of round 6 photo 7 make a single_crochet make 6 more fpsc s photo 8 chain 1 and turn 7 b single_crochet x 7 working into the 7 st s of row a chain 1 and turn the last st might be a bit tricky to get into 7 c single_crochet x 7 chain 1 and bind off see photo 9 7 7 8 9 7 now take up the coloured yarn again continuing on where you left off at the end of round 6 single_crochet in the first st the st that already contains the first fpsc - see photo 10 working into the row of the window single_crochet x 2 up the side of the window photo 11 single_crochet increase in the first st of row c window single_crochet x 5 working into each st of row c single_crochet increase in the last st of row c single_crochet x 2 down the other side of the window working into each row as before photo 12 single_crochet into the st at the base of the window the one right next to the fpsc - see photos 13 and 14 single_crochet x 10 into the remaining st s of round 6 25 10 11 12 8 single_crochet x 4 this will bring you to the top of the window working into the blo single_crochet x 7 across the top of the window photo 15 working through both loops for the rest of the round single_crochet x 14 25 9-11 single_crochet x 25 25 working through blo across the top of the
